allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
feat(compute): implement CUDA and WindowsML GPU backends

Add full GPU compute acceleration support for NVIDIA CUDA and Windows ML/DirectML:

CUDA Backend (gpu_cuda.rs):
- Complete cudarc integration with NVRTC runtime compilation
- Filter operations (i32, i64, f64) with all comparison predicates
- Bitmap operations (AND, OR, NOT) for combining filter masks
- Aggregation operations (SUM, COUNT, MIN, MAX)
- Vector similarity (cosine, euclidean, dot product)
- Spatial distance (2D Euclidean, Haversine)
- Graph traversal (BFS, Dijkstra)
- Tiled matrix multiplication (GEMM)
- Time-series window aggregation
- Hash join operations (build & probe)
- Windows and Linux platform support

WindowsML Backend (gpu_windowsml.rs):
- DirectX 12 device initialization
- DirectML availability detection
- GpuDevice trait implementation
- CPU fallback with rayon parallel processing
- Windows 10 1903+ support

CUDA Kernels (shaders/cuda/database_kernels.cu):
- Optimized CUDA kernels matching Metal shader functionality
- Thread group optimization (256 threads per block)
- Atomic operations for aggregations
- Shared memory tiling for matrix operations

Feature flags:
- gpu-cuda: Enables CUDA support with cudarc dependency
- gpu-windowsml: Enables WindowsML/DirectML (Windows only)
